On Aug 11, 2004, at 10:03 AM, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

> michael sorens wrote:
>
>> Just the information I needed on source folders in Eclipse! However, 
>> I'm
>> having trouble figuring out in Eclipse how to specify separate output
>> folders for each source folder. The help file even has just such a 
>> help
>> topic, but the instructions are not quite coherent (to me, anyway). 
>> Could
>> someone elucidate?
>
> Right-click your project, choose Properties.
> Select Java Build Path.
> Select the Source tab.
> Check the box "Allow output folders for source folders".
> Now select each source folder, press Edit...
> Set the output folder for that source folder.
> Repeat for all source folders.

Additionally, for some reason you need to tell the compile that it can 
output to multiple locations:

Right-click on the project and choose Properties
Select Java Compiler
Select the Build Path tab
Check "Enable use of multiple output locations..."

You can configure this on a workspace-wide basis (rather than just a 
single project) using "Configure Workspace Settings" in the "Java 
Compiler" panel.

Cheers,

Mike
